verses.kjv: Hear ye this, O priests; and hearken, ye house of Israel; and give ye ear, O house of the king; for judgment is toward you, because ye have been a snare on Mizpah, and a net spread upon Tabor.
verses.ct: Listen to this, you priests! Pay attention, people of Israel! Hear this, you royal household! This judgment is directed at you, because you have been a trap at Mizpah and a net spread out on Tabor.

verses.kjv: And the revolters are profound to make slaughter, though I have been a rebuker of them all.
verses.ct: The rebels have sunk deep into slaughter, but I will discipline every one of them.

verses.kjv: I know Ephraim, and Israel is not hid from me: for now, O Ephraim, thou committest whoredom, and Israel is defiled.
verses.ct: I know Ephraim well, and Israel is not hidden from me. Right now, Ephraim, you are prostituting yourself, and Israel has become corrupt.

verses.kjv: They will not frame their doings to turn unto their God: for the spirit of whoredoms is in the midst of them, and they have not known the LORD.
verses.ct: Their actions will not allow them to return to their God, because a spirit of prostitution is at work among them, and they do not acknowledge the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the pride of Israel doth testify to his face: therefore shall Israel and Ephraim fall in their iniquity; Judah also shall fall with them.
verses.ct: Israel's arrogance testifies against them. So Israel and Ephraim will stumble because of their sin, and Judah will stumble along with them.

verses.kjv: They shall go with their flocks and with their herds to seek the LORD; but they shall not find him; he hath withdrawn himself from them.
verses.ct: They will go looking for the LORD with their flocks and herds to offer sacrifices, but they will not find him. He has pulled away from them.

verses.kjv: They have dealt treacherously against the LORD: for they have begotten strange children: now shall a month devour them with their portions.
verses.ct: They have been unfaithful to the LORD, because they have produced illegitimate children. Now a single month will consume them along with everything they have.

verses.kjv: Blow ye the cornet in Gibeah, and the trumpet in Ramah: cry aloud at Bethaven, after thee, O Benjamin.
verses.ct: Sound the ram's horn in Gibeah! Blow the trumpet in Ramah! Raise the alarm at Beth-aven! The enemy is right behind you, Benjamin!

verses.kjv: Ephraim shall be desolate in the day of rebuke: among the tribes of Israel have I made known that which shall surely be.
verses.ct: Ephraim will become a wasteland on the day of punishment. Among the tribes of Israel, I have announced what will certainly happen.

verses.kjv: The princes of Judah were like them that remove the bound: therefore I will pour out my wrath upon them like water.
verses.ct: The leaders of Judah act like those who move boundary markers. So I will pour out my fury on them like a flood of water.

verses.kjv: Ephraim is oppressed and broken in judgment, because he willingly walked after the commandment.
verses.ct: Ephraim is crushed and broken by judgment, because he was determined to chase after worthless commands.

verses.kjv: Therefore will I be unto Ephraim as a moth, and to the house of Judah as rottenness.
verses.ct: So I will be like a moth eating away at Ephraim, and like decay rotting the house of Judah.

verses.kjv: When Ephraim saw his sickness, and Judah saw his wound, then went Ephraim to the Assyrian, and sent to king Jareb: yet could he not heal you, nor cure you of your wound.
verses.ct: When Ephraim noticed his illness and Judah saw his wounds, Ephraim turned to Assyria and sent for help from the great king. But he cannot heal you or cure your wounds.

verses.kjv: For I will be unto Ephraim as a lion, and as a young lion to the house of Judah: I, even I, will tear and go away; I will take away, and none shall rescue him.
verses.ct: Because I will be like a lion to Ephraim, and like a young lion to the house of Judah. I myself will tear them apart and walk away. I will carry them off, and no one will be able to rescue them.

verses.kjv: I will go and return to my place, till they acknowledge their offence, and seek my face: in their affliction they will seek me early.
verses.ct: I will go back to my place until they admit their guilt and seek my presence. When they are suffering, they will desperately search for me.
